DataElement.preferredDefinition: The standard or agency upon which the specific term used as the diagnosis value was obtained.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An indicator of the particular group or agency that supplied a specific term._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, Third Edition
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms.

Concepts.longName: International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, Third Edition
Concepts.definition: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics._The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A term that refers to the WHO 5th edition classification of central nervous system neoplasms defined by the combination of molecular diagnostics with histopathological and immunohistochemical findings.

Concepts.definition: A term that refers to the WHO 5th edition classification of central nervous system neoplasms defined by the combination of molecular diagnostics with histopathological and immunohistochemical findings.
